$!You must tell DVLA if you have an alcohol problem.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence##

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form DR1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘DR1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 236KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_066648.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D


##Bus, coach or lorry licence##

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form DR1V and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘DR1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 200KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_172723.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D


*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency

title: Alcohol problems and driving
